item.title: 20170303 UT MAT157/MAT247 RSG: Exam Break
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

In the tense time of midterms, I hope you feel composed and ready for new challenges.

I will be able to attend the session today due to an exam, but there are still vacant classrooms you can go to and eager communities you can join.

For example, Gal Gross and Putnamites are meeting today, March 3rd, in BA 4010 from 16:00 to 20:00 to plow through Chapter 2 of "Putnam and Beyond".

If you are looking for a spare room, here is the link to the availability calendar:

http://www.osm.utoronto.ca/bookings/f?p=200:3:171524085299201::::P3_BLDG,P3_ROOM:,

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: UT MAT157/MAT247 RSG: Reading Week and Talks
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope your exams are going well.

With all the activities, events and preparations, the most active participants of our sessions have, there is a considerably lesser number of us who will probably come to the session today.

If you are eager to meet, please drop me an email. Otherwise, there are lots of other opportunities where you can spend your time.

For example, there is an introductory tutorial to P vs NP organised by UofT Undegraduate Theory Group and given by Eric Bannatyne (http://ericbannatyne.ca/) in BA3116 from 14:00 to 15:00. Moreover, there is a Putnam-style problem-solving session organised by Gal Gross in BA4010 from 17:00 to 19:00.

Good luck to Lola, who sets off to a battle in a big winterguard competition, and Thomas, grappling with MUN, and to each one of you.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: UT MAT157/MAT247 RSG: Session V
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you have had a productive week.

I suggest we meet today at 3.00 pm in BA4010, as usual, for more problem-solving and knowledge-sharing.

Hope to see you there.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: UT MAT157/MAT247 RSG: Session IV
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I suggest we meet tomorrow at 15:00 in BA4010 for joyful problem solving.

There is also a talk at 17:00 organized by MU in Room 1190 which you might find interesting:

"The hallway problem considers adjacent parallel hallways of unit width each with a single doorway (aligned with integer lattice points) of unit width. It then asks: what are the properties of lines that pass through each doorway? Configurations of doorways closely correspond to Sturmian words, and so properties of these configurations may be lifted to properties of Sturmian words. This talk will explore lines of sight, lines that pass through each doorway, for both the case for both a finite number of parallel hallways and an infinite number, and their consequences for Sturmian words. We then produce a metric on configurations with an infinite number of hallways that preserves the property of admitting a line of sight under limits."

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: 20170127 UT MAT157/MAT247 RSG: Study Session III + MUGS VII
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

!新年快乐

I hope you are still eager to plunge into some more problem solving.

I suggest we meet tomorrow at 15:00 in BA4010. Straight after our session, at 17:00, there is a talk in BA1170 on meets and greets – ahem – knots and graphs, given by Katie Walsh, for whom it is one of the tests required to work at UofT. So we are lucky!

Hope to see you there.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: 20170120 UT MAT157/MAT247: Study Session II
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

For all of you interested in doing some problems together, I suggest we meet in BA4010 tomorrow at 15:00.

There is a Putnam Club running at 17:00 in the same room as well, so we will finish by then and thus will have an opportunity to attend the VI MUG talk, given by Dr. Brendan Kelly on "How many ways to the coffee house?".

"A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems",- said Rényi, so you might as well give a shot to the talk.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: UT MAT157/MAT240: Happy New Year!
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

Happy New Year!

I hope you have had a great break.

I also hope that we are ready to continue our investigative climb.

Tomorrow, on Friday 13, I suggest we meet in BA1220 at 3 pm. Please note the change of time and place – it seems that this room is the only one in Bahen which suits our needs.

If you have any comments or suggestions, please feel free to write me or reply to all in order to make your message visible to everyone.

If you also want to win special prizes as most active participants, in order to kickstart our seminar work, please present some problems tomorrow which you find exciting or (nota bene: not xor) confusing and which you are eager to grapple with during the session.

See you soon.

Onwards!

— sasha

item.title: UT MAT157/MAT240 RSG: CCR
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you enjoy the pastime relatively free from pressure of mandatory activities. Let me add yet another such activity to your schedule.

With all the great work you have done this semester, to be recognized on the CCR it is necessary to complete a reflection at

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/RSGparticiapnts

by January 9th.

If you have any questions, please forward them to Michaela at fasstudentsuccess@gmail.com.

Thank you for your fruitful engagement.

Onwards!

— sasha

item.title: 20161209 UT MAT240: Friday Session
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you are having a productive exam period. For your interest, there are past MAT240 exams from various sources published on the ut.umu page in the MAT240 Resources section.

With 3 people who have answered (thank you, Lola, Matthew and Vanessa), I wonder if we wish to meet today, as usual, at 16:10 in Bahen, B026 (seminar room), for a practice session.

Could you please tell me if this time fits your schedule? Do you have any suggestions, wishes or any secret longings regarding the session you would like to share?

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Good luck to all of you who have an exam today!

Onwards!

— sasha

item.title: UT MAT240: Preparation for the Final | Arrangements
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

Thank you to all of you who have replied!

Lola has expressed the options nicely:

  • Not on a weekend, and
  • Either of: – On a Friday, or – One, but not both, of: — On a Tuesday, xor — Before 3:30pm

[ ~(weekend) ] ∧ [ (Friday) ∨ [ (Tuesday) ⊻ (Before 3:30pm) ] ]

I know also that there are exams some of us have on December 14 and 15, so December 13 to 15 including are probably not the best days to hold the session.

Unless you have already done so, could you please tell me whether you are interested in meeting up at any time noted above?

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Have a productive day!

— sasha
